algorithmes
Class SelectionneurMemoire

java.lang.Object
  algorithmes.SelectionneurMemoire
All Implemented Interfaces:
Selectionneur, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SelectionneurNN, SelectionneurQL
public abstract class SelectionneurMemoire
extends Object
implements Selectionneur

The base of all Q-Learning-like algorithms :

  • Provides a structure to memorize or compute the Q(s,a)
  • Contains all the parameters used in the Q-Learning update rules
  • Contains all the parameters used to control convergence

Version:
$Revision: 1.0 $
Author:
Francesco De Comite (decomite at lifl.fr)
See Also:
Serialized Form

decayAlpha

protected double decayAlpha
Factor by which we multiply alpha at each learning step (geometric decay)
Note : geometric decay does no insure convergence.

count

protected double count
Number of learning steps

alphaDecayPower

protected double alphaDecayPower
Power of decay when alpha=1/(count^alphaDecayPower)

See Also:
Learning rates for Q-Learning

geometricDecay

protected boolean geometricDecay
Alpha decay methods
  • Geometric : use decayAlpha
  • Exponential : use alphaDecayPower (default)

rouletteWheel

protected boolean rouletteWheel
How to implement randomness ?
  • epsilon-greedy
  • Roulette wheel selection
  • Boltzmann
      • Roulette wheel or Boltzmann selection makes epsilon useless.

epsilonGreedy

protected boolean epsilonGreedy

boltzmann

protected boolean boltzmann

tau

protected double tau

getGeometricDecay

public boolean getGeometricDecay()
How convergence is controlled ?
  • true : alpha decays geometrically
  • false : alpha decays exponentially

apprend in interface Selectionneur

getChoix2

protected Action getChoix2(ListeActions l)
Roulette Wheel selection of the next action : the probability for an action to be chosen is relative to its Q(s,a) value. TODO DEBUG : not valid if Q(s,a) can be negative !!!
